item.title: PS5 DualSense Hall Effect Stick Replacements Now Available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps5-dualsense-hall-effect-stick-replacements-now-available/1100-6528320/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There’s a lot to love about the PS5 DualSense controller, but there’s also one big oversight--it doesn’t use Hall Effect joysticks. That means it can--and often does--succumb to joystick drift over time, which is less than ideal for a $75 gamepad. Thankfully, Hyperkin has just released a PS5 Hall Effect Joystick Replacement Kit, allowing you to replace both sticks for just $16. They’re proving to be wildly popular (Amazon is temporarily out of stock), but you can still place orders while waiting for inventory to replenish.

Hyperkin PS5 Hall Effect Joystick Replacement Kit

$16

Before picking up this cool replacement kit, be warned that the installation process is a bit involved. The main hurdle is soldering, though you’ll also have to use a screwdriver to calibrate its positioning. That means novice modders should steer clear of this operation or ensure they have a professional game shop nearby that can help with the installation.

Hyperkin's replacement joysticks are rated for 5 million rotations and thanks to the way the Hall Effect sensors work, they won't drift over time like the DualSense's base sticks can. At just $16, these are a much wiser investment than buying a new controller--assuming you have the necessary skill to install them.

If you don't wat to wait for Hyperkin's PS5 joystick replacement kit to restock, another option is the AKNES GuliKit TMR Electromagnetic Joystick Replacement Kit, which is currently in stock and available for $18. It's available in PS5 and Xbox Series X versions, and just like Hyperkin's Hall Effect sticks kit, the GuilKit TMR joystick replacements will require soldering and careful installation. TMR Electromagnetic joysticks are similar to Hall Effect sticks, but they’re typically more sensitive and often seen as having a slight advantage over Hall Effect. You can't go wrong with either, as both types of technology are leagues ahead of their analog counterparts.

Path of Exile 2 is finally out in early access and while only half of the eventual content is in the game right now, there are still hours of playtime available. Players can progress through three campaign Acts, dozens of varied and challenging bosses, six distinct classes, and plenty of different gear iterations.

While you can choose to carve out your own path in Path of Exile 2, there's no harm in taking a look at some guides for help along the way. That's where we come in, and you can check out every guide we've done so far in Path of Exile 2 below.

  • Path of Exile 2 guides hub
    • Starter guides

Path of Exile 2 guides hub

We have divided our guides hub into various categories so you can scroll through to easily find whatever you're searching for. Whether it be a tough boss fight or a build guide, we'll have a guide on it in the coming days and weeks following the early access release of Path of Exile 2. More guides will be added to the hub as new content comes to the ARPG as well.

Starter guides

If you're just starting out in Path of Exile 2 or are perhaps new to ARPGs as a whole, this is the section you'll want to pay attention to initially. These guides go over basic mechanics, settings, and other content you'll find at the start of the game.

  • Cross-Play And Cross-Save Explained
  • Release Date, Early Access, And Eveything We Know
  • Best PC Settings To Use
  • How To Get Uncut Skill Gems
  • How To Upgrade Healing And Mana Flasks
  • How To Identify Items For Free
  • How To Respec Passive Skills

Quest guides

Stuck on a certain quest? Maybe you're not sure how to progress or how to find the next zone to proceed with your current objective. Either way, if you need help with any quest-related goal, check out these guides.

  • How To Unlock The Salvage Bench And Salvage Items
  • How To Get Into The Village In Trail Of Corruption
  • How To Open The Memorial Gate In The Cemetery

Boss fights

Path of Exile 2 features some extremely tough boss fights. While some are easier than others, a few bosses make you scratch your head and wonder how in the world you're going to get past it. To make your life simpler, we've broken down some of the harder bosses in the game and given you the best strategies to defeat them.

  • How To Beat The Executioner

Build guides

Finally, if you're playing a certain class, you'll likely have some questions about what skills to use or what to spend your passive ability points on. That's where the build guides come in, giving a starting path on the best ways to play your chosen class in Path of Exile 2.

That wraps up all the guides we've done in Path of Exile 2. As we previously mentioned, more guides are being added to this hub frequently, so check back soon if you don't see the guide you need.

item.title: Get The New Indiana Jones Xbox Game Free When You Eat $200's Worth Of Pancakes
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/get-the-new-indiana-jones-xbox-game-free-when-you-eat-200s-worth-of-pancakes/1100-6528318/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The partnership between Xbox and IHOP kicked off in November with a special-edition custom pancake Xbox and a menu inspired by Indiana Jones and the Great Circle. Now it's come to light that the partnership also includes the opportunity to get Indiana Jones and the Great Circle for "free" if you spend enough money at IHOP.

As spotted by Wario64, one of the perks of joining IHOP's loyalty program is the opportunity to earn PanCoins, which can be exchanged for a free copy of the game. It doesn't come cheap, though. Members earn one PanCoin for every $5 spent, and to unlock The Great Circle, you need 40 PanCoins ($200).

The Great Circle isn't the only game available, though, as 40 PanCoins also gets you a copy of Sea of Thieves, which is a completely different type of game. Meanwhile, 15 PanCoins gets you a one-month trial for Game Pass Ultimate. You can see all the available rewards on IHOP's website.

Of course, eating a lot of breakfast food is not the most direct or logical way to go about getting your hands on The Great Circle. After all, the game is included with Game Pass Ultimate ($20/month) and PC Game Pass ($12/month), and is also available for direct purchase starting at $70 USD. As it happens, Game Pass is steeply discounted right now, just in time for the launch of The Great Circle.

The Great Circle is out now on Xbox and PC, and will come to PlayStation 5 in Spring 2025. For more, be sure to read GameSpot's Indiana Jones and the Great Circle review and consult our guides hub to hit the ground running.

item.title: First Borderlands 4 Gameplay Footage Will Debut At The Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/first-borderlands-4-gameplay-footage-will-debut-at-the-game-awards/1100-6528319/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Gearbox Software boss Randy Pitchford has confirmed that a new trailer for Borderlands 4 will be shown off at The Game Awards this week. On Twitter/X, Pitchford teased that the next look at the upcoming game will contain a mix of gameplay and a "never-before-seen original cinematic sequence" set halfway between the end of Borderlands 3 and the beginning of Borderlands 4.

Yes, there is GAME PLAY in the trailer! Also, in addition to a lot of in-game footage, I will share a sick, never-before-seen original cinematic sequence depicting a moment that occurs about half way between the end of Borderlands 3 and the beginning of Borderlands 4. I AM… https://t.co/yV7r7WUlRt

— Randy Pitchford (@DuvalMagic) December 9, 2024

Although Pitchford has regularly teased the game, little is known about Borderlands 4 so far. While there has been a trickle of information--like one of the new planets being shown off in concept art--details on the playable Vault Hunters, the next big villain, or if Claptrap will ever get people to attend his pizza party have been kept locked up tighter than an Eridian vault.

One snippet of information that Pitchford did confirm was that the antagonist for the game won't be Handsome Jack, as something "far more dangerous" than the legendary Hyperion CEO will be threatening players. While this will be a first look at the game for many fans this week, a terminally ill Borderlands fan named Caleb McAlpine managed to get a sneak peek at the game after Gearbox heard of his request to see it.

Borderlands 4 was officially revealed during the opening night of Gamescom in August, and the game is scheduled to launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC in 2025. Publisher Take-Two Interactive plans to have a comfortable gap between Borderlands 4 and Grand Theft Auto 6, as it wants to avoid cannibalizing potential sales.
